title: How have perceptions of inpatient rooms and ward cleanliness changed?
analysis_commentary:
In 2015 98% of respondents said their room or ward was fairly or very clean. The proportion of patients who felt that the hospital room or ward they were in was very clean has been increasing over the past 10 years, from 53% in 2006, to 71% in 2015. Since 2013, almost no respondents said their room was not at all clean, down from 2% of respondents in 2005.
Updated August 2016.
